questions.question_text:
You run a Windows 2012 R2 Hyper-V Role Server, you need to shrink the size of files.vhd.
Which PowerShell cmdlet option you should run first?

discussion.content: No - if Shrink is only available for VHDX so if you convert to VHDX first, then you can shrink. The answer is Convert.
C. Resize. Through one must convert first before resizing
its copy from contoso and paste to adatum.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
Your network contains two Active Directory forests named contoso.com and adatum.com.
A two-way forest trust exists between the forests.
You have custom starter Group Policy objects (GPOs) defined in contoso.com.
You need to ensure that the same set of custom starter GPOs are available in adatum.com.
In the table below, identify which action must be performed for the starter GPOs container in each forest. Make only one selection in two of the rows. Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

You work as a senior administrator at Contoso.com. The Contoso.com network consists of a single domain named Contoso.com. All servers on the Contoso.com network have Windows Server 2012 installed.
You are running a training exercise for junior administrators. You are currently discussing Storage Spaces.
Which of the following is TRUE with regards to Storage Spaces?

choices.C: Storage spaces are virtual disks with associated attributes such as a preferred level of resiliency, and thin or fixed provisioning.
choices.A: Mirroring and parity are optional resilient storage modes of Storage Spaces.
choices.D: Storage spaces are a collection of physical disks with associated attributes such as a preferred level of resiliency, and thin or fixed provisioning. AC
choices.B: Failover clustering is not supported by Storage Spaces.

discussion.content: The correct answer is B.The Get-ADComputer cmdlet gets a computer or performs a search to retrieve multiple computers.

choices.D: You should consider making use of Add-Computer Windows PowerShell cmdlet on ENSUREPASS-SR15.
choices.B: You should consider making use of Get-Computer Windows PowerShell cmdlet on ENSUREPASS-SR15.
choices.A: You should consider making use of Set-Computer Windows PowerShell cmdlet on ENSUREPASS-SR15.
choices.C: You should consider making use of Test-Computer Windows PowerShell cmdlet on ENSUREPASS-SR15.

questions.answer_description: Add-Computer Add the local computer to a domain or workgroup.
questions.question_text:
You work as an administrator at Contoso.com. The Contoso.com network consists of a single domain named Contoso.com.
Contoso.com has a domain controller, named ENSUREPASS-DC01, which has Windows Server 2012 R2 installed. Another Contoso.com domain controller, named ENSUREPASS-DC02, has Windows Server 2008 R2 installed.
You have deployed a server, named ENSUREPASS-SR15, on Contoso.coms perimeter network. ENSUREPASSSR15 is running a Server Core Installation of
Windows Server 2012 R2.
You have been instructed to make sure that ENSUREPASS-SR15 is part of the Contoso.com domain.
Which of the following actions should you take?

questions.answer_description:
The followingexample demonstrates how to create a new UPN suffix for the users in the Fabrikam.com forest:
Set-ADForest -UPNSuffixes @{Add="headquarters.fabrikam.com"}
questions.question_text:
Your network contains one Active Directory domain named contoso.com. The domain contains 10 domain controllers and a read-only domain controller (RODC) named RODC01.
You need to ensure that when administrators create users in contoso.com, the default user principal name (UPN) suffix is litwareinc.com.
Which cmdlet should you use?

discussion.content: According explanation H is correct Set-ADForest
